jcr:root.jcr:description:
I am planning a vacation, and I have gotten as far as 1) I’m getting my passport stamped and 2) I’m going to sit my butt on a warm beach. After reading up on this community, I have a sudden itch to try out surfing.
Since I will be leaving the country, Hawaii is not on my list of destinations. Plus, I will be going next spring and from what I can tell the waves aren’t so fantastic then anyway. Does anyone have any suggestions as to where I should go? I’m pretty open to anything.
jcr:root.jcr:title: International surfing
jcr:root.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/536.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/19.0.1084.56 Safari/536.5

as7i-australia_andsouth.jcr:description: Australia and South Africa immediately come to mind, but you do have to deal with the Great White population and I don’t know how you feel about that. I would suggest going down to Bali. The city isn’t the greatest place in the world to visit, but the beaches and surfing are world class.
as7i-australia_andsouth.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/536.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/19.0.1084.56 Safari/536.5

lt0y-i_m_not_muchofasu.jcr:description: I’m not much of a surfer, but I do know that France is known as the surfing capitol of Europe. However, if you want the whole tropical beach experience, go to Cloud Nine in the Philippines.
lt0y-i_m_not_muchofasu.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/536.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/19.0.1084.56 Safari/536.5

wxgw-i_read_thatevenif.jcr:description: I read that even if you surf all the time, you are still more likely to get struck by lightening than get attacked by a shark.
wxgw-i_read_thatevenif.userAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/536.5 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/19.0.1084.56 Safari/536.5
